main event: On 24 June 1947 in Idaho, a civilian observed a comet-like object in the sky, which was later attributed to celestial objects like Saturn or Mercury, depending on the time of observation.
interesting points: The observation lacked specific details such as the length of observation, distance of the object, and physical evidence.
The possibility of the observed object being a persistent meteor train was considered due to the limited description of the incident.
Depending on the time of observation, it was suggested that the object could have been the planet Saturn or Mercury, both of which were visible shortly after sunset on that day.
The observation was made by a Lieutenant Governor, giving some credibility to the report.
The report mentions the use of a telescope to observe the object for approximately 45 seconds to 1 minute, during which no vapor trail was observed.
